message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible opportunity to purchase a unique and valuable product. I'm willing to sell it to you for $20000. I believe this product will bring you great value and I'm confident you'll love it. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate the value you see in the product. However, my budget is limited. I am willing to pay up to $15000 for the product. I hope we can come to an agreement.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that you have a limited budget, but I'm confident that the product's value exceeds $15000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I'm counteroffering at $18000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and the benefits it will bring to you.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Alice. While I understand the value of the product, I still believe that $18000 is a bit too high for me. I would like to propose a price of $16000. I hope this aligns better with your expectations and budget.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob. I'm willing to consider your offer, but I still need to make a profit. I'm not willing to go as low as $16000, but I can meet you in the middle again. I'm counteroffering at $17500. This price reflects the value I believe the product has, and I'm hoping you'll see the benefits it will bring to you.

Thank you for your latest offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I am willing to pay $17000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price given its value and the benefits it will bring to me.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob. I'm willing to make one final offer. I've already compromised on the price, but I still need to ensure I get a fair deal. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $18000, which is my final counteroffer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
